DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease After Initial Therapy Less Initial Pathologic Diagnosis Date Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time interval in days from the date of the patient's initial pathologic diagnosis to the date of tumor recurrence after initial treament.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Recurrent Disease After Initial Therapy Subtract Diagnosis Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._The act of removing a part from the whole._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Recurrent Disease Post First Therapeutic Procedure Subtraction Diagnosis Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of removing a part from the whole.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created per request by B.McClure-Shimel and released per approval by C.Savage. mc 6/15/12

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of Days from Date of I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of Days from Date of Initial Pathologic Diagnosis to the Date of Tumor Recurrence After Initial Treatment

DataElement.changeDescription: Created per request by B.McClure-Shimel and released per approval by C.Savage. mc 6/15/12
